question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Given that
\[\begin{vmatrix} a & b & c \\ d & e & f \\ g & h & i \end{vmatrix} = -7,\]find
\[\begin{vmatrix} a & b & c \\ 2d + 5g & 2e + 5h & 2f + 5i \\ -g & -h & -i \end{vmatrix}.\]
inference:
Using the properties of determinants, we have
\[\begin{vmatrix} a & b & c \\ 2d + 5g & 2e + 5h & 2f + 5i \\ -g & -h & -i \end{vmatrix} = \begin{vmatrix} a & b & c \\ d & e & f \\ g & h & i \end{vmatrix} \begin{vmatrix} 2 & 5 & 0 \\ 0 & 2 & 5 \\ -1 & -1 & -1 \end{vmatrix}.\]

The determinant of the matrix on the right is
\[\begin{vmatrix} 2 & 5 & 0 \\ 0 & 2 & 5 \\ -1 & -1 & -1 \end{vmatrix} = 2\begin{vmatrix} 2 & 5 \\ -1 & -1 \end{vmatrix} - 5\begin{vmatrix} 0 & 5 \\ -1 & -1 \end{vmatrix} = 2(2 + 5) - 5(0 + 5) = 14 - 25 = -11.\]

Therefore,
\[\begin{vmatrix} a & b & c \\ 2d + 5g & 2e + 5h & 2f + 5i \\ -g & -h & -i \end{vmatrix} = -7 \cdot (-11) = \boxed{77}.\]
Final Answer: \boxed{77}. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth:
We are told that
\[\begin{vmatrix} a & b & c \\ d & e & f \\ g & h & i \end{vmatrix} = -7.\]If we multiply the second row by 2, then we get
\[\begin{vmatrix} a & b & c \\ 2d & 2e & 2f \\ g & h & i \end{vmatrix} = -14.\]Adding five times the third row to the second row does not change the value of the determinant:
\[\begin{vmatrix} a & b & c \\ 2d + 5g & 2e + 5h & 2f + 5i \\ g & h & i \end{vmatrix} = -14.\]Then multiplying the third row by $-1$ gives us
\[\begin{vmatrix} a & b & c \\ 2d + 5g & 2e + 5h & 2f + 5i \\ -g & -h & -i \end{vmatrix} = \boxed{14}.\]

question:

The determinant of the matrix on the right is

ground_truth:
We are told that
\[\begin{vmatrix} a & b & c \\ d & e & f \\ g & h & i \end{vmatrix} = -7.\]If we multiply the second row by 2, then we get
\[\begin{vmatrix} a & b & c \\ 2d & 2e & 2f \\ g & h & i \end{vmatrix} = -14.\]Adding five times the third row to the second row does not change the value of the determinant:
\[\begin{vmatrix} a & b & c \\ 2d + 5g & 2e + 5h & 2f + 5i \\ g & h & i \end{vmatrix} = -14.\]Then multiplying the third row by $-1$ gives us
\[\begin{vmatrix} a & b & c \\ 2d + 5g & 2e + 5h & 2f + 5i \\ -g & -h & -i \end{vmatrix} = \boxed{14}.\]
